revised_title: Description of the Complete Adult Dentition of a New Extinct Mammal from Patagonia (Homalodotherium Cunninghami)
tldr: The author describes the complete adult dentition of a new genus of extinct mammal, Homalodotherium Cunninghami, discovered in deposits on the banks of the River Gallegos, South Patagonia. The animal's teeth present a remarkable gradual transition in characters and are more similar to those of the genus Rhinoceros than any other known mammal.
